tweet: I wrote @USPS Tuesday after learning that the decal on the door of the Dorothy Height Post Office in DC misspelled this civil rights icon’s name. They informed me today that the decal is being replaced. I’m thankful for their quick response.
With the charges dropped against Michael Flynn yesterday, we again see President Trump bending the rules for his friends. Shameless.

I support the Iran War Powers Resolution the Senate voted on today, but DC residents had no vote on this matter of war and peace, even though our residents have always funded and fought in our nation’s wars. #DCStatehood

National Nurses Week, honoring these #FrontLineHeroes, is right on time this year. 

Nurses save others by risking their own lives every day, but that takes on a new meaning right now. Thank you for sacrificing so much for the rest of us.

#NationalNursesWeek

This week, Public Service Recognition Week, is perfectly timed for the unprecedented pandemic.

If you’re a police officer, sanitation worker, postal worker or one of the many unnamed workers who continue at risk to provide public service: Thank you for doing more than your part.

After learning of a misspelling on the door of the Dorothy Height Post Office, I wrote the Postmaster General requesting an immediate correction.

As Godmother of the Civil Rights Movement, we need to – at minimum – give Ms. Height the respect of spelling her name correctly.

Last week, the Smithsonian Women’s History Museum Act, which I cosponsored, passed the House. For too long, women’s history has been left out of the telling of our nation’s history. I am proud that this museum is planned in my own district! https://t.co/boTLva47Xj

The Census will determine how billions of dollars in federal funds are allocated. A warning to DC: in years past, the District has suffered from a costly undercount. I recently asked officials what plans they have to ensure an accurate count. https://t.co/iUSamWwNbp

Congratulations David Gibson Jr. of @SportsMarkit for your recent Evolve Entrepreneurship Award. DC has a thriving small business community and I’m thrilled to see one of our own recognized. https://t.co/o6mNWq5Da8
Thank you @EricHolder for adding your voice, as one of DC’s most distinguished residents, to our call for #DCstatehood. https://t.co/crCZA394Np

This #BlackHistoryMonth, thank you @ABC7Sam and @ABC7News for capturing some of my work in the South during the Civil Rights Movement. Our rights weren’t given to us – we demanded them. The same could be said for #DCstatehood. https://t.co/AI9Wetw2BT

Climate change has serious consequences for emergency response – even for animals! From pets to livestock, climate is a threat to our ability to keep communities safe. See my questions from a recent hearing on protecting animals in disaster areas. https://t.co/9JCe5A6RsG

Thank you to @amprog for your recent endorsement of our #DCstatehood bill. Progressive values mean standing up for a representative democracy. D.C. statehood is a key voting and civil rights issue of our time. Onward to the House floor!

As momentum for #DCstatehood continues to gain steam, coverage will only increase. I hope that other Americans see the injustice in their nation’s capital. Let them see that we pay the highest per capita taxes of any jurisdiction, without representation. https://t.co/9IQeMa7Gol

Thank you to the District residents who packed the halls of Congress yesterday. It was thrilling to preside for part of the markup that speeds us to the next historic step – on to the House floor! #DCstatehood https://t.co/Z0sxgd654l
Thank you Chairwoman @RepMaloney for your leadership in helping DC make history with the Committee vote on #DCstatehood. Onward to the House floor! https://t.co/Plsyx7qaBe

HISTORY

The House Committee on Oversight and Reform just passed our #DCstatehood bill.

For the first time since 1993, we are heading to the House floor! 

It's time for #DCstatehood.
